content.description: More fun, steep 5.9 climbing, starts of with some steep jug hauling then pull over some more bulges.
content.location: Just to the right of the first unknown 5.9. This is the second route around right from "Spits or Swallows" on the main Beaver Wall. It is the second route from the left on Beaver Wall Right.

content.description:
Time to drop that brush and those Solutions and lace up your TC pros because what your lucky gym rat ass has just stumbled upon is a sport bolted chimney. Very forgiving for chimney climbing, and surprisingly quite enjoyable.

 Crux is likely getting off the ground, otherwise things seem to get progressively easier the higher you get...depending on your body size of course.

 --

 Can also be led on gear by squeezing farther in, which would make it almost an entirely separate route...
content.protection: 6 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor. Or gear if you want an extra challenge.
content.location: The obvious bolted chimney to the right of two steep 5.9s. The third route to the right of "Spits or Swallows" 12a (The last route on the right side of the main Beaver Wall)

content.description: Fun and steep 5.9 climbing pulling over multiple bulges. Very similar in character to the next 5.9 to the right, and that route could easily be toproped from the same anchor as this one.
content.location: The first route to the right of "Spits of Swallows" on the main Beaver Wall. Leftmost route of Beaver Wall right.

content.description: A good introductory 5.10, with a single move that might be 10a mixed in with a lot of fun, juggy 5.8/5.9 climbing.
content.location: Rightmost route on Beaver wall Right. First route to the left of Chimichonga. Immediately right of Cats in the Cradle.

content.description: Climb bulge and pockets to a bulge with great pocket with a shallow crack above,(crux) a very tricky  crux,
content.location: Between Beaver Wall and Mr Jimmy Boulder,  Just to the right of Beaver Wall, on the next buttress, 1st bolted line to the right of dirty chimney,

content.description: Start with some fun pocket pulling, reach a burly, reachy stand-up single move crux, that seemed to me to be somewhat improbable for 5.11, and continue romping up to the anchors.
content.protection: 5 bolts to 2 bolt anchor. Easy to set on toprope from either of the 5.10s to the right, if one were so inclined.
content.location: The second route to the right of the obvious bolted chimney. The third route to the left of Chimichonga 5.8. Start by a 2 foot tall tree stump.

content.description: Pull down on the holds, and go up. Another classic pocket-pulling adventure.
content.protection: 5 bolts, 2 bolt anchor. Anchor is very easy to reach from the 10a to the right, if one were so inclined.
content.location: Second route around to the left from Chimichonga, route to the right of Cougar Love 11b.

content.description: This is the wall around the right hand corner from "Spits or Swallows" 12a, the rightmost route on the main Beaver Wall. It is described in Yusuf Daneshayar's guide as "Beaver Wall Right," so I am adding it here as that.
